en.ch_modal_veritas_p1: This account has had 12 posts corrected for factual inaccuracy in the last 90 days. Below are recent examples.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note1_post: Post (Jun 27): "the powers that be don't want you to know the sky is not blue"
en.ch_modal_veritas_note1_ctx: Context: The sky appears blue due to Rayleigh scattering. Shorter, bluer wavelengths are scattered more by air molecules. Source: NASA
en.ch_modal_veritas_note2_post: Post (Jun 27): "(((they))) are trying to make you believe 2+2=4. break the conditioning"
en.ch_modal_veritas_note2_ctx: Context: 2+2=4 is a mathematical axiom. The triple parentheses are often used as an antisemitic symbol.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note3_ctx: Context: "Wetness" is the sensation of a liquid adhering to a solid. This claim misinterprets a philosophical debate.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note4_post: Post (Jun 15): "The wind turbines are actually giant fans to cool the planet..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note4_ctx: Context: Wind turbines are generators that convert wind's kinetic energy into electricity. Source: U.S. Dept. of Energy
en.ch_modal_veritas_note5_post: Post (Jun 11): "Finland isn't a real country. It's an invention of Japan..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note5_ctx: Context: Finland is a sovereign nation. This is a recurring, satirical conspiracy theory.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note6_post: Post (Jun 5): "You can charge your phone by putting it in the microwave..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note6_ctx: Context: Microwaving a phone will destroy it and could cause a fire. This is extremely dangerous.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note7_post: Post (May 30): "Birds aren't real, they are surveillance drones..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note7_ctx: Context: Birds are avian dinosaurs and well-documented living creatures. This is a popular satirical conspiracy theory.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note8_ctx: Context: The sun's surface is approximately 9,940Â°F (5,505Â°C) due to nuclear fusion. Source: NASA
en.ch_modal_veritas_note9_post: Post (May 18): "Eating sand is a good way to get essential minerals..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note9_ctx: Context: Eating sand is dangerous and can lead to intestinal blockages and other serious health issues.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note10_post: Post (May 12): "The moon landing was faked... no stars in the pictures."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note10_ctx: Context: The cameras had fast shutter speeds for the bright lunar surface, which were too short to capture faint stars.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note11_post: Post (May 5): "If you type your PIN number backwards at an ATM..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note11_ctx: Context: This is a long-running hoax. Typing a PIN backwards will simply be registered as an incorrect PIN.
en.ch_modal_veritas_note12_post: Post (Apr 28): "Every 'leap year' is a day the government adds to the calendar..."
en.ch_modal_veritas_note12_ctx: Context: Leap years keep the calendar synchronized with the astronomical year, preventing seasonal drift.
en.ch_modal_chloe_p1: This account has had 3 posts corrected for factual inaccuracy in the last 90 days. Below are the examples.
en.ch_modal_chloe_note1_post: Post (Jun 27): "Look up, people! They're spraying us with chemtrails..."
en.ch_modal_chloe_note1_ctx: Context: The lines seen are persistent condensation trails ("contrails") from aircraft engines. Source: EPA, FAA.
en.ch_modal_chloe_note2_ctx: Context: Historians have documented the methods used by ancient Egyptians, including ramps and levers, to construct the pyramids.
en.ch_modal_chloe_note3_post: Post (May 20): "The world's powerful elites are secretly lizards in human skin suits."
en.ch_modal_chloe_note3_ctx: Context: This is a popular conspiracy theory with no basis in fact. There is no evidence to support the claim.
